title: Why I don't regret being arrested protesting with Extinction Rebellion
text:
It's the trolls' favourite trope to label us hypocrites, but at least we recognise that things must urgently change

On Monday I was arrested at the Extinction Rebellion protest in Trafalgar Square on two offences - obstructing a highway and public nuisance (I have not been charged, but an investigation is pending). The last thing I saw before I was bundled into a police van was a crowd of people cheering me on in front of Nelson’s Column. I’m not trying to glamourise it, that’s just what happened.

Four others were arrested with me – three men and a woman – all of whom I would guess were in their Sixties. None smelled remotely of hemp or looked at all crusty. One wore a suit in the correct size....
